intro: Tithymalus arkansanus, commonly known as the Arkansas tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
